required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Comparison of Symbicort® pMDI 2 x 160/4.5 μg Bid and 2 x 80/4.5 μg Bid With Formoterol Turbuhaler® 2 x 4.5 μg Bid and Placebo in Patients With COPD
clinical_study.official_title: A 12-Month Double-Blind, Double-Dummy, Randomized, Parallel Group, Multicenter Efficacy and Safety Study of Symbicort® pMDI 2 x 160/4.5 μg Bid and 2 x 80/4.5 μg Bid Compared to Formoterol Turbuhaler® 2 x 4.5 μg Bid and Placebo in Patients With COPD

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare Symbicort in a pressurized metered-dose inhaler (pMDI) with formoterol and placebo in the long-term maintenance treatment of patients with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD).

primary_outcome.measure: Pre-dose and 1-hour post-dose FEV1 over the 12 months treatment period

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient-reported outcome variables regarding disease status (incl. PEF), collected via questionnaires and diaries
Safety variables, including adverse events, vital signs, ECG, physical examination, hematology, and clinical chemistry.
all variables assessed over the 12 months treatment period

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- A clinical diagnosis of COPD with symptoms for more than 2 years.
- Smoking history of 10 or more pack years
- A history of at least one COPD exacerbation requiring a course of oral steroids and/or antibiotics within 1-12 months before first visit.
Exclusion Criteria:
- A history of asthma
- Patients taking oral steroids
- Any significant disease or disorder that may jeopardize the safety of the patient

overall_official.last_name: AstraZeneca Symbicort Medical Science Director, MD
